detailsOfAchievement: Kalvi Trust believes on ensuring quality education is both the means and the end to a better life: means because it empowers an individual to earn livelihood and the end because it increase awareness with self to face the issues in the society and survive as self reliant. Kalvi envisions a society, where quality education will be received by each and every one, irrespective of their social and economic standing Kalvi Trust is presently involved in development activities such as child development through quality education, language development, educational scholarships; Youth development through Distance education, Vocational education, Skill Building and Employability; women development through entrepreneurship skill development and financial assistance.Kalvi presently works with more than 20,000 families in rural areas and urban slums in 16 districts  Madurai, Dindigul, Theni, Nagapattinam, Coimbatore, Tuticorin, Thirunelveli, Virudhunagar, Ramnathapuram, Kanniyakumari, Chennai, Thiruchirapalli, Erode, Villupuram, Salem, Krishnagiriin the State of Tamil Nadu in South India.

It increased the production and consumption of organic vegetables.

This project intended to bring positive change in the lives of the alcoholic and drug addicted people in diocese of Thuckalay. The target beneficiaries of this project were youth and adult. Youth were trained in various cultural performances like thappattam kollattam oliyattam and they conveyed the bad effects of alcoholism and drug addiction to the public through the street plays. Trainings were given on behaviour problem strategies to modify the problem and intervention techniques.
Educare programme is educational sponsorship programme where a donor is supporting a student with Rs.7000/- per year for 5 consecutive years. Manu send support 4 students for five years.

This fund was given by a well wisher from UK for the charitable and administrative purpose. 10 families were helped for either treatment or construction of the house or for students pursuing higher studies. Also Salaries were paid to the nursery teachers who are working under KKSSS.

It is a family development programme to enhance the economic status of the poor and marginalized families through regular financial support and introduce and train them in different income generating activities.

This project is aimed to start a primary health center in the remote areas and to provide ambulance service to poor population were health facilities are inadequate in accessible and in affordable. This an ongoing project and many poor and bedridden patients are benefiting from this service.

To improve the socio economic status of the poor women through mushroom production was the aim of this project. Trainings were given to interested women and enable them start their own production units. It helped the women to earn additional income for their livelihood.

This project was to empower the backward class women through tailoring. Most of the people of the area are poor and agricultural laborer. Training was given in tailoring and it enabled the women to meet their own needs and earn some additional income for their livelihood.

Increasing Equitable Access to Livelihoods and employment for People with Disabilities (PwDs) in India project envisages to identify, Assess, provide soft skills, Vocational skill and placed them in to wage and self employments in Chennai, Cuddalore, Nagapattinam, Thiruvallur Tiruvarur , Kanchipuram and Villupuram Districts of Tamil Nadu state and Pondycherry and Karikal ares of Puducherry Union Territory.

Ability Based Livelihood Empowerment (ABLE) Projcet envisages to Training and Employments to persons with Learning disabilities . For this project we conduct Base line and end line assessment of candidates enrolled and train 10 persons with Learning disabilities of 18 years and above 80% of trained candidates to be employed.we offer range of activities which encourage candidates to learn and explore their environment.
